title: Curecanti National Recreation Area: Stevens Creek
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Eating & Sleeping     Camping     Stevens Creek                Stevens Creek Campground              Stevens Creek Campground is located 12 miles west of Gunnison on U.S. Highway 50 on the shore of Blue Mesa Reservoir. All types of camping from tents to large RVs can be accommodated at Stevens Creek. First-come first-served sites can usually be found except on summer holiday weekends.    Approximate Open Dates: late-May to mid-October   Sites: 53   Accessible Sites: yes    Water:  yes, late-May to mid-September    Flush Toilets:  no     Vault Toilets:  yes    Electric Hookups:  no   Dump Station:  no    Showers:  no    Tables & Fire Grates:  yes    Visitor Center:  no    Ranger Programs:  no    Marina:  no   Restaurant:  no   Boat Ramp:  yes    Fish Cleaning Station:  yes    Elevation:  7540 feet            Reservation Information Reservations can be made for sites in Loop A only. Reservations must be made at least 3 days in advance. All reservable sites have a maximum 14 consecutive day stay in a 30 day period.  Stevens Creek Campground Map (pdf) »      Fees     Loops B & C (first-come first-served)  $16.00 per night ($8.00 per night with Interagency Senior/Access Pass)    Loop A  $16.00 per night, plus $3.00 if reserved ($8.00 per night with Interagency Senior/Access Pass, plus $3.00 per night if reserved)
